commitMessage:
fix: wire --create-pm flag to CLI parser in hodge plan command (HODGE-300)

## What Changed
- Modified src/bin/hodge.ts (4 lines):
  - Added `--create-pm` option to Commander.js parser
  - Removed `--local-only` option (wasn't functional)
  - Updated TypeScript type signature for action handler
  
- Modified src/commands/plan.ts (2 lines):
  - Removed `localOnly` from PlanOptions interface
  - Cleaned up interface comment
  
- Modified src/commands/plan.test.ts (36 lines added, 2 changed):
  - Updated existing test to remove `localOnly` usage
  - Added new smoke test "should accept --create-pm flag without crashing"
  - New test verifies flag is accepted and PM creation is attempted gracefully
  
- Auto-updated src/lib/claude-commands.ts (24 lines):
  - Synced command documentation formatting

## Why This Change
The `--create-pm` flag existed in the PlanCommand code but wasn't registered
in the CLI parser, making it impossible to create PM issues through the
command line. This broke the `/plan` slash command workflow which relies on
explicit user approval before creating PM issues in Linear.

The fix follows "safe by default" principle: without the flag, plans are
saved locally only. With `--create-pm`, PM issues are created in Linear.

## Impact
- âœ… `/plan` slash command now works correctly
- âœ… Users can create PM issues with explicit `--create-pm` flag
- âœ… Safe default behavior (local-only save without flag)
- âœ… All 598 tests passing, including 6 plan command smoke tests
- âœ… No breaking changes (old `--local-only` flag wasn't working anyway)

Closes HODGE-300
